intro: Telipogon nirii, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a member of the Asphodelaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its stiff, upright stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white in color. Telipogon nirii is native to New Zealand and is adapted to grow in a variety of soil types. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for native wildlife.
